cards.name: City of Brass
cards.text:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add one mana of any color.

rulings.text: The first ability triggers no matter how the land becomes tapped.

If you tap City of Brass while you are casting a spell or activating an ability, its ability will trigger and wait. When you finish casting that spell or activating that ability, City of Brass's triggered ability is put on the stack on top of it. City of Brass's ability will resolve first.

On the other hand, you can tap City of Brass, put its triggered ability on the stack, and then respond to that ability by casting an instant or activating an ability using that mana. In that case, the instant spell or activated ability will resolve first.

cards.originalText:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Safe Haven
cards.text:
{2}, {T}: Exile target creature you control.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice Safe Haven. If you do, return each card exiled with Safe Haven to the battlefield under its owner's control.

rulings.text: When creatures return to the battlefield, they are put onto the battlefield as if just cast. Creatures with X in the mana cost are treated as X is zero. Creatures which can pay costs when put onto the battlefield to determine abilities must have those costs paid at this time.
Token creatures cease to exist when they leave the battlefield, so this effect just exiles them with no chance to bring them back like you can with cards.
If changed to another land type, the creature cards are not lost but can't be released until the land reverts to normal.
When the creature leaves the battlefield any damage or "will be destroyed at some future time" effects are removed from the creature.
Auras on creatures are put into the graveyard and counters on creatures are removed when the creatures are sent to the Haven.
Creatures return to the control of their owners, regardless of who controls the Haven when it is sacrificed.
All cards in the Haven stay there even if they cease to be creatures. When the Haven is sacrificed, the cards come back onto the battlefield whether or not they are creatures.
Creatures return to the battlefield simultaneously.

cards.originalText:
{2}, {T}: Remove target creature you control from the game. Play this ability as an interrupt.
{0}: Sacrifice Safe Haven to return all creatures it has removed from the game directly into play under their owners' control as though they were just summoned. Use this ability during your upkeep.

cards.name: Urza's Mine
cards.text: {T}: Add {C}. If you control an Urza's Power-Plant and an Urza's Tower, add {C}{C} instead.
cards.flavor: Mines became common as cities during the days of the artificers.

rulings.text: If you have at least one of each of the three Urza's lands on the battlefield, you must take the 2 mana instead of just one.

cards.originalText: {T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool. If you control Urza's Mine, Urza's Tower, and Urza's Power Plant, add two colorless mana to your mana pool instead of one.

cards.name: Blessed Breath
cards.text:
Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
Splice onto Arcane {W} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

rulings.text: You reveal all cards you intend to splice at the same time. Each individual card can be spliced only once onto any one spell.
A card with a splice ability can't be spliced onto itself because the spell is on the stack (and not in your hand) when you reveal the cards you want to splice onto it.

You choose all targets for the spell after revealing cards you want to splice, including any targets required by the text of any of those cards. You may choose a different target for each instance of the word "target" on the resulting spell.
If all of the spell's targets are illegal when the spell tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen.

cards.originalText:
Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
Splice onto Arcane {W} (As you play an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

cards.name: Bushi Tenderfoot
cards.text: When a creature dealt damage by Bushi Tenderfoot this turn dies, flip Bushi Tenderfoot.
cards.originalText: When a creature dealt damage by Bushi Tenderfoot this turn is put into a graveyard, flip Bushi Tenderfoot.

cards.name: Kenzo the Hardhearted
cards.text: Double strike; bushido 2 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.)
cards.originalText: When a creature dealt damage by Bushi Tenderfoot this turn is put into a graveyard, flip Bushi Tenderfoot.

cards.name: Cage of Hands
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
{1}{W}: Return Cage of Hands to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Our own actions built the prisons that now hold us. Our hands reached too far and tried to hold too much."
—Dosan the Falling Leaf
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
{1}{W}: Return Cage of Hands to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Call to Glory
cards.text: Untap all creatures you control. Samurai creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"General Takeno glared at us as if we were the enemy. 'The day is not over yet,' he shouted, 'and unless you have a nezumi's heart, you will stand and fight'"
—Battle of Akagi River: A Survivor's Tale
cards.originalText: Untap all creatures you control. Samurai you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Candles' Glow
cards.text:
Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.
Splice onto Arcane {1}{W} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

rulings.text: You reveal all cards you intend to splice at the same time. Each individual card can be spliced only once onto any one spell.
A card with a splice ability can't be spliced onto itself because the spell is on the stack (and not in your hand) when you reveal the cards you want to splice onto it.

You choose all targets for the spell after revealing cards you want to splice, including any targets required by the text of any of those cards. You may choose a different target for each instance of the word "target" on the resulting spell.
If all of the spell's targets are illegal when the spell tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen.

cards.originalText:
Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn. You gain 1 life for each damage prevented this way.
Splice onto Arcane {1}{W} (As you play an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

cards.name: Cleanfall
cards.text: Destroy all enchantments.
cards.flavor: During the war, the rites of purification were still effective, but the kami, not the kitsune, chose what to cleanse.
cards.originalText: Destroy all enchantments.

cards.name: Devoted Retainer
cards.text: Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor: Deep within Eiganjo Castle lay the Palace of Infinite Halls, a seemingly endless network of corridors once guarded by a seemingly endless legion of samurai.
cards.originalText: Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.name: Eight-and-a-Half-Tails
cards.text:
{1}{W}: Target permanent you control gains protection from white until end of turn.
{1}: Target spell or permanent becomes white until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Virtue is an inner light that can prevail in every soul."

rulings.text: A permanent spell that becomes white this way will enter the battlefield and continue to be white until end of turn.

cards.originalText:
{1}{W}: Target permanent you control gains protection from white until end of turn.
{1}: Target spell or permanent becomes white until end of turn.

cards.name: Ethereal Haze
cards.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt by creatures this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Imagine a dove flying through smoke. Does the dove injure the smoke? Does the smoke impede the dove?"
—Teachings of Eight-and-a-Half-Tails
cards.originalText: Prevent all damage that would be dealt by creatures this turn.

cards.name: Ghostly Prison
cards.text: Creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {2} for each creature they control that's attacking you.
cards.flavor: Destroyed in one of the first battles of the Kami War, the town of Reito still grieved.

rulings.text: In the Two-Headed Giant format, you still only have to pay once per creature.
Unless some effect explicitly says otherwise, a creature that can't attack you can still attack a planeswalker you control.

cards.originalText: Creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {2} for each creature attacking you. (This cost is paid as attackers are declared.)

cards.name: Harsh Deceiver
cards.text:
{1}: Look at the top card of your library.
{2}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a land card, untap Harsh Deceiver and it gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.originalText:
{1}: Look at the top card of your library.
{2}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a land, untap Harsh Deceiver and it gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Play this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Hikari, Twilight Guardian
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may exile Hikari, Twilight Guardian. If you do, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

rulings.text: You may choose not to exile Hikari.
If you exile Hikari, it leaves the battlefield before the spell that triggered it resolves its ability, so it will be unaffected by that spell.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may remove Hikari, Twilight Guardian from the game. If you do, return it to play under its owner's control at end of turn.

cards.name: Hold the Line
cards.text: Blocking creatures get +7/+7 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Forgive me, Master Kami, but in the interest of my people I must halt your advance."
cards.originalText: Blocking creatures get +7/+7 until end of turn.

cards.name: Honden of Cleansing Fire
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you gain 2 life for each Shrine you control.
cards.flavor: To the sorrow of all, its fire was turned toward those who worshipped it.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, you gain 2 life for each Shrine you control.

cards.name: Horizon Seed
cards.text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, regenerate target creature.
cards.flavor: In peaceful times, these beings escorted the honored kami to their new shrines. In the Kami War, they became the medics of an unstoppable army.
cards.originalText: Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, regenerate target creature.

cards.name: Hundred-Talon Kami
cards.text:
Flying
Soulshift 4 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 4 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)
cards.originalText:
Flying
Soulshift 4 (When this is put into a graveyard from play, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 4 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.name: Indomitable Will
cards.text:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.
cards.flavor:
"None of you are yet samurai. Defend your homes with honor, die for your cause, and perhaps then you will be worthy of the word."
—General Takeno
cards.originalText:
You may play Indomitable Will any time you could play an instant.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.

cards.name: Innocence Kami
cards.text:
{W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, untap Innocence Kami.
cards.flavor: Her voice was light, her substance music.
cards.originalText:
{W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, untap Innocence Kami.

cards.name: Isamaru, Hound of Konda
cards.flavor: The hound sniffed the air and let slip a low growl. General Takeno looked down at the faithful Isamaru and calmed him with a touch. "Alert the men. The kami are coming."

cards.name: Kabuto Moth
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Target creature gets +1/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Many great warriors died in the first days of the war, as the spirits of their weaponry turned against them with terrifying rage."
—Observations of the Kami War
cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: Target creature gets +1/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Kami of Ancient Law
cards.text: Sacrifice Kami of Ancient Law: Destroy target enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"Duty and law are the foundation on which civilization stands. They must not fall, for when they do, they take everything with them."
—Lord Konda
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Kami of Ancient Law: Destroy target enchantment.

cards.name: Kami of Old Stone
cards.flavor:
"There was a wall here. Now it is dust. A tower rose here. Now it is fallen. An army fought here. Now it is dead. A spirit was here. It is all that remains."
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet

cards.name: Kami of the Painted Road
cards.text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, Kami of the Painted Road gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
cards.flavor: In ancient times, precepts of kami law were inscribed onto bridges as a gesture of respect. During the war, humans regarded them as warnings of where not to travel.
cards.originalText: Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, Kami of the Painted Road gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.text:
Flying, first strike
Soulshift 5 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 5 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

foreignNames.name: Kami de los jardines del palacio

Flying, first strike
Soulshift 5 (When this is put into a graveyard from play, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 5 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.name: Kitsune Blademaster
cards.text:
First strike
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor: Those kitsune trained in the blade preferred to fight with a blade-catching jitte in the off hand, buying them just enough time to deliver the first deadly cut.
cards.originalText:
First strike
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.name: Kitsune Diviner
cards.text: {T}: Tap target Spirit.
cards.flavor: She who once led prayers honoring the kami adapted to use her influence to stay them.
cards.originalText: {T}: Tap target Spirit.

cards.originalText: At end of turn, if Kitsune Mystic is enchanted by two or more enchantments, flip it.

cards.name: Autumn-Tail, Kitsune Sage
cards.text: {1}: Attach target Aura attached to a creature to another creature.
cards.originalText: At end of turn, if Kitsune Mystic is enchanted by two or more enchantments, flip it.

cards.text: Protection from Spirits and from Arcane
cards.flavor: The wake of his passage shoved aside the influence of the kami.

cards.text:
Vigilance, indestructible
Bushido 5 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +5/+5 until end of turn.)
cards.originalText:
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
Bushido 5 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +5/+5 until end of turn.)
Konda, Lord of Eiganjo is indestructible.

cards.name: Konda's Hatamoto
cards.text:
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
As long as you control a legendary Samurai, Konda's Hatamoto gets +1/+2 and has vigilance. (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
As long as you control a legendary Samurai, Konda's Hatamoto gets +1/+2 and has vigilance. (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

cards.name: Lantern Kami
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"Snuffing the light of a lantern without saying a small prayer is bad luck. Though its flame can only singe, its soul can repeatedly visit misery on one's house."
—Teachings of Eight-and-a-Half-Tails
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Masako the Humorless
cards.text:
Flash
Tapped creatures you control can block as though they were untapped.
cards.flavor: Konda's servants dared not neglect their duties for a moment under Masako's icy gaze, knowing that what she saw, Lord Konda would hear.

rulings.text: Masako allows tapped creatures to block only if they could otherwise block. It doesn't allow creatures that "can't block" to block, nonflying creatures to block fliers, etc.

cards.originalText:
You may play Masako the Humorless any time you could play an instant.
Tapped creatures you control may block as though they were untapped.

cards.name: Mothrider Samurai
cards.text:
Flying
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor: When the night blossoms open, the wings of Eiganjo take flight.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.name: Myojin of Cleansing Fire
cards.text:
Myojin of Cleansing Fire enters the battlefield with a divinity counter on it if you cast it from your hand.
Myojin of Cleansing Fire has indestructible as long as it has a divinity counter on it.
Remove a divinity counter from Myojin of Cleansing Fire: Destroy all other creatures.

rulings.text: In a Commander game where this card is your commander, casting it from the Command zone does not count as casting it from your hand.

cards.originalText:
Myojin of Cleansing Fire comes into play with a divinity counter on it if you played it from your hand.
Myojin of Cleansing Fire is indestructible as long as it has a divinity counter on it.
Remove a divinity counter from Myojin of Cleansing Fire: Destroy each other creature.

cards.name: Nagao, Bound by Honor
cards.text:
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever Nagao, Bound by Honor attacks, Samurai creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

foreignNames.name: 義理に縛られし者、長雄

cards.originalText:
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever Nagao, Bound by Honor attacks, Samurai you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Otherworldly Journey
cards.text: Exile target creature. At the beginning of the next end step, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor:
"The landscape shimmered and I felt a chill breeze. When my vision cleared, I found myself alone among the corpses of my fallen friends."
—Journal found in Numai

rulings.text: The creature comes back onto the battlefield as a new creature, with one +1/+1 counter on it (plus any other counters that it would normally enter the battlefield with).
Any Aura attached to the creature is put into its owner's graveyard as a state-based action. Equipment attached to the creature become unattached but remain on the battlefield.
If Otherworldly Journey is cast during an end step, the creature won't return until the beginning of the next end step.

cards.originalText: Remove target creature from the game. At end of turn, return that creature to play under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Pious Kitsune
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a devotion counter on Pious Kitsune. Then if a creature named Eight-and-a-Half-Tails is on the battlefield, you gain 1 life for each devotion counter on Pious Kitsune.
{T}, Remove a devotion counter from Pious Kitsune: You gain 1 life.
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a devotion counter on Pious Kitsune. Then if a creature named Eight-and-a-Half-Tails is in play, you gain 1 life for each devotion counter on Pious Kitsune.
{T}, Remove a devotion counter from Pious Kitsune: You gain 1 life.

cards.name: Quiet Purity
cards.text: Destroy target enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"When the Kami of Utter Silence passes, walls lose their secrets. Scrolls lose their lessons. Tapestries lose their beauty. Where there was meaning, there is only stillness."
—Sensei Hisoka
cards.originalText: Destroy target enchantment.

cards.name: Reciprocate
cards.text: Exile target creature that dealt damage to you this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Just as the noble soul calls virtue to itself, the evil soul summons harm."
—Teachings of Eight-and-a-Half-Tails
cards.originalText: Remove from the game target creature that dealt damage to you this turn.

cards.name: Reverse the Sands
cards.text: Redistribute any number of players' life totals. (Each of those players gets one life total back.)
cards.flavor: Worse than the years of aging was the burden of memory. The young monk lost his youth and gained a vicarious lifetime of hardship and woe.

rulings.text: You choose which player gets which life total when the spell resolves.

You can't split up a life total when you redistribute it. For example, suppose that in a two-player game your life total is 5 and your opponent's life total is 15 when Reverse the Sands starts to resolve. You can choose to (a) leave the life totals as they are or (b) make your life total 15 and your opponent's 5. You can't choose to make your life total 20 and your opponent's 0.

cards.originalText: Redistribute any number of players' life totals. (Each of those players gets one life total back.)

cards.name: Samurai Enforcers
cards.text: Bushido 2 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor: From the moment they swore their oaths, they belonged to their lord, sword and soul.
cards.originalText: Bushido 2 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.)

cards.name: Samurai of the Pale Curtain
cards.text:
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
If a permanent would be put into a graveyard, exile it instead.
cards.originalText:
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
If a permanent would be put into a graveyard, remove it from the game instead.

cards.name: Sensei Golden-Tail
cards.text:
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{1}{W}, {T}: Put a training counter on target creature. That creature gains bushido 1 and becomes a Samurai in addition to its other creature types. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

rulings.text: The training counter just marks which creatures have been changed; an effect that removes the counter doesn't change the creature's types or abilities.
Note that multiple instances of the bushido ability each trigger separately.

cards.originalText:
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{1}{W}, {T}: Put a training counter on target creature. That creature gains bushido 1 and becomes a Samurai in addition to its other creature types. Play this ability only any time you could play a sorcery.

cards.name: Silent-Chant Zubera
cards.text: When Silent-Chant Zubera dies, you gain 2 life for each Zubera that died this turn.
cards.flavor: When the Honden of Cleansing Fire was abandoned, its attendants swarmed Kamigawa to erode mortal will.
cards.originalText: When Silent-Chant Zubera is put into a graveyard from play, you gain 2 life for each Zubera put into a graveyard from play this turn.

cards.name: Takeno, Samurai General
cards.text:
Bushido 2 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.)
Each other Samurai creature you control gets +1/+1 for each point of bushido it has.
cards.originalText:
Bushido 2 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.)
Each other Samurai you control gets +1/+1 for each point of bushido it has.

cards.name: Terashi's Cry
cards.text: Tap up to three target creatures.
cards.flavor:
"The sun kami is terrible to behold. When its temper flares, best seek shade and pray for forgiveness."
—Sensei Golden-Tail
cards.originalText: Tap up to three target creatures.

cards.name: Vassal's Duty
cards.text: {1}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to target legendary creature you control this turn is dealt to you instead.
cards.flavor: "My life is yours, my lord. There is no greater service than to yield it for your safety."
cards.originalText: {1}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to target legendary creature you control this turn is dealt to you instead.

cards.name: Vigilance
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has vigilance. (Attacking doesn't cause it to tap.)
cards.flavor:
"Put a spear in a peasant's hands, and you have an expendable troop. Put a purpose in his heart, and you win a warrior."
—Sensei Golden-Tail
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature has vigilance. (Attacking doesn't cause it to tap.)

cards.name: Yosei, the Morning Star
cards.text:
Flying
When Yosei, the Morning Star dies, target player skips their next untap step. Tap up to five target permanents that player controls.

rulings.text: If any of the targets of Yosei's ability are illegal, they won't be tapped.
If all of the permanents targeted by Yosei's ability become illegal targets, nothing becomes tapped, but the target player still skips their untap step.
If the player becomes an illegal target, the target permanents are tapped, but the player doesn't skip their untap step.
If a permanent won't untap during its controller's next untap step, that effect waits to apply until its controller has an untap step that isn't skipped.

If more than one effect instructs a player to skip their next untap step, such as if Yosei dies more than once in a turn, that player skips that many untap steps. This is different from effects that state that something doesn't untap during an untap step.

foreignNames.name: Yosei, la estrella de la mañana

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Yosei, the Morning Star is put into a graveyard from play, target player skips his or her next untap step. Tap up to five target permanents that player controls.

cards.name: Aura of Dominion
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{1}, Tap an untapped creature you control: Untap enchanted creature.
cards.flavor:
"Lies and deceit do yield results, but legitimate authority is the ultimate form of control."
—Meloku the Clouded Mirror
cards.originalText: {1}, Tap an untapped creature you control: Untap enchanted creature.

cards.name: Azami, Lady of Scrolls
cards.text: Tap an untapped Wizard you control: Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Choices belong to those with the luxuries of time and distance. We have neither. I recommend we proceed with the plan to destroy all shrines of the kami."
—Lady Azami, letter to Sensei Hisoka
cards.originalText: Tap an untapped Wizard you control: Draw a card.

cards.name: Callous Deceiver
cards.text:
{1}: Look at the top card of your library.
{2}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a land card, Callous Deceiver gets +1/+0 and gains flying until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.originalText:
{1}: Look at the top card of your library.
{2}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a land, Callous Deceiver gets +1/+0 and gains flying until end of turn. Play this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Consuming Vortex
cards.text:
Return target creature to its owner's hand.
Splice onto Arcane {3}{U} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

rulings.text: You reveal all cards you intend to splice at the same time. Each individual card can be spliced only once onto any one spell.
A card with a splice ability can't be spliced onto itself because the spell is on the stack (and not in your hand) when you reveal the cards you want to splice onto it.

You choose all targets for the spell after revealing cards you want to splice, including any targets required by the text of any of those cards. You may choose a different target for each instance of the word "target" on the resulting spell.
If all of the spell's targets are illegal when the spell tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen.

cards.originalText:
Return target creature to its owner's hand.
Splice onto Arcane {3}{U} (As you play an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

cards.name: Counsel of the Soratami
cards.text: Draw two cards.
cards.flavor: "Wisdom is not the counting of all the drops in a waterfall. Wisdom is learning why the water seeks the earth."
cards.originalText: Draw two cards.

cards.name: Cut the Tethers
cards.text: For each Spirit, return it to its owner's hand unless that player pays {3}.
cards.flavor:
"You cannot bar the path of gods. You can only divert their journey for a while."
—Sensei Hisoka
cards.originalText: For each Spirit, return it to its owner's hand unless that player pays {3}.

cards.name: Dampen Thought
cards.text:
Target player puts the top four cards of their library into their graveyard.
Splice onto Arcane {1}{U} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

rulings.text: You reveal all cards you intend to splice at the same time. Each individual card can be spliced only once onto any one spell.
A card with a splice ability can't be spliced onto itself because the spell is on the stack (and not in your hand) when you reveal the cards you want to splice onto it.

You choose all targets for the spell after revealing cards you want to splice, including any targets required by the text of any of those cards. You may choose a different target for each instance of the word "target" on the resulting spell.
If all of the spell's targets are illegal when the spell tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen.

cards.originalText:
Target player puts the top four cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
Splice onto Arcane {1}{U} (As you play an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

cards.name: Eerie Procession
cards.text: Search your library for an Arcane card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"Though in years past speculation was not encouraged about the strange ways of kami, now we must understand their motivations, if such is even possible to the mortal mind."
—Lady Azami
cards.originalText: Search your library for an Arcane card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Eye of Nowhere
cards.text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Once we prayed to the kaijin for safe voyage. Now we only pray that we can escape their gaze."
—Hayato, master sailor
cards.originalText: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Field of Reality
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be blocked by Spirits.
{1}{U}: Return Field of Reality to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"The scholars of the Minamo School understood the veil between their world and that of the kami. Moreover, they knew how to exploit it."
—Observations of the Kami War
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature can't be blocked by Spirits.
{1}{U}: Return Field of Reality to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Floating-Dream Zubera
cards.text: When Floating-Dream Zubera dies, draw a card for each Zubera that died this turn.
cards.flavor: When the Honden of Seeing Winds was forgotten, its attendants swarmed Kamigawa to uncover mortal secrets.
cards.originalText: When Floating-Dream Zubera is put into a graveyard from play, draw a card for each Zubera put into a graveyard from play this turn.

cards.name: Gifts Ungiven
cards.text: Search your library for up to four cards with different names and reveal them. Target opponent chooses two of those cards. Put the chosen cards into your graveyard and the rest into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You can choose to find fewer than four cards if you want. If you find one or two cards, your opponent must choose for them to be put into your graveyard, even if they don't want to.

cards.originalText: Search your library for four cards with different names and reveal them. Target opponent chooses two of those cards. Put the chosen cards into your graveyard and the rest into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Graceful Adept
cards.text: You have no maximum hand size.
cards.flavor:
"When you have mastered my lessons, it will seem as though the whole of the world has opened up to your mind and nothing is beyond your grasp."
—Lady Azami

rulings.text: If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then put Graceful Adept onto the battlefield, you'll have no maximum hand size. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.

cards.originalText: You have no maximum hand size.

cards.name: Guardian of Solitude
cards.text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, target creature gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"It seemed an easy thing, to step into the nothingness, to fall, to die. But then, for an instant, I saw it, eyes filled with endless sorrow, and I turned back to face my pain."
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet
cards.originalText: Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, target creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Hinder
cards.text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put that card on the top or bottom of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"Do not react to force in kind. Turn it aside. Direct it to where it can do no harm."
—Meloku the Clouded Mirror
cards.originalText: Counter target spell. If it's countered this way, put that card on the top or bottom of its owner's library instead of that player's graveyard.

cards.name: Hisoka, Minamo Sensei
cards.text: {2}{U}, Discard a card: Counter target spell if it has the same converted mana cost as the discarded card.
cards.flavor: "By all rights we should have perished in the Kami War. Our perseverence is a tribute to mortal ingenuity. And perhaps a few forgotten secrets found in the nick of time."
cards.originalText: {2}{U}, Discard a card: Counter target spell if it has the same converted mana cost as the discarded card.

cards.name: Hisoka's Defiance
cards.text: Counter target Spirit or Arcane spell.
cards.flavor: "With every passing day, the kami shape our world to suit their will. I, for one, would not see them succeed."
cards.originalText: Counter target Spirit or Arcane spell.

cards.name: Hisoka's Guard
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Hisoka's Guard during your untap step.
{1}{U}, {T}: Target creature you control other than Hisoka's Guard has shroud for as long as Hisoka's Guard remains tapped. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.originalText:
You may choose not to untap Hisoka's Guard during your untap step.
{1}{U}, {T}: As long as Hisoka's Guard remains tapped, target creature you control other than Hisoka's Guard can't be the target of spells or abilities.

cards.name: Honden of Seeing Winds
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card for each Shrine you control.
cards.flavor: To the sorrow of all, its winds found sin in the hearts of those who once learned from its wisdom.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card for each Shrine you control.

cards.name: Jushi Apprentice
cards.text: {2}{U}, {T}: Draw a card. If you have nine or more cards in hand, flip Jushi Apprentice.
cards.originalText: {2}{U}, {T}: Draw a card. If you have nine or more cards in hand, flip Jushi Apprentice.

cards.name: Tomoya the Revealer
cards.text: {3}{U}{U}, {T}: Target player draws X cards, where X is the number of cards in your hand.
cards.originalText: {2}{U}, {T}: Draw a card. If you have nine or more cards in hand, flip Jushi Apprentice.

cards.name: Kami of Twisted Reflection
cards.text: Sacrifice Kami of Twisted Reflection: Return target creature you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Its form reflected humanity as it stood during the Kami War: disjointed, confused, and incomplete.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Kami of Twisted Reflection: Return target creature you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Meloku the Clouded Mirror
cards.text:
Flying
{1}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Create a 1/1 blue Illusion creature token with flying.
cards.flavor: He loved his cities in the clouds. When he traveled to the lands below, he brought many reminders of his home.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Put a 1/1 blue Illusion creature token with flying into play.

cards.name: Myojin of Seeing Winds
cards.text:
Myojin of Seeing Winds enters the battlefield with a divinity counter on it if you cast it from your hand.
Myojin of Seeing Winds has indestructible as long as it has a divinity counter on it.
Remove a divinity counter from Myojin of Seeing Winds: Draw a card for each permanent you control.

rulings.text: In a Commander game where this card is your commander, casting it from the Command zone does not count as casting it from your hand.

cards.originalText:
Myojin of Seeing Winds comes into play with a divinity counter on it if you played it from your hand.
Myojin of Seeing Winds is indestructible as long as it has a divinity counter on it.
Remove a divinity counter from Myojin of Seeing Winds: Draw a card for each permanent you control.

cards.name: Mystic Restraints
cards.text:
Flash
Enchant creature
When Mystic Restraints enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
cards.originalText:
You may play Mystic Restraints any time you could play an instant.
When Mystic Restraints comes into play, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

cards.name: Part the Veil
cards.text: Return all creatures you control to their owner's hand.
cards.flavor: At the waterfall, the border between the humanoid and the spirit worlds was weakest. The kami moved across it with ease and at will.
cards.originalText: Return all creatures you control to their owner's hand.

cards.name: Peer Through Depths
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal an instant or sorcery card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

rulings.text: If you don't reveal an instant or sorcery card, put all the revealed cards on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.originalText: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal an instant or sorcery card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Petals of Insight
cards.text: Look at the top three cards of your library. You may put those cards on the bottom of your library in any order. If you do, return Petals of Insight to its owner's hand. Otherwise, draw three cards.

rulings.text: If you choose to put the three cards on the bottom of your library, Petals of Insight will return to your hand directly from the stack. It never goes to a graveyard.

cards.originalText: Look at the top three cards of your library. You may put those cards on the bottom of your library in any order. If you do, return Petals of Insight to its owner's hand. Otherwise, draw three cards.

cards.text:
You may tap or untap target permanent.
Splice onto Arcane {U} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

rulings.text: You reveal all cards you intend to splice at the same time. Each individual card can be spliced only once onto any one spell.
A card with a splice ability can't be spliced onto itself because the spell is on the stack (and not in your hand) when you reveal the cards you want to splice onto it.

You choose all targets for the spell after revealing cards you want to splice, including any targets required by the text of any of those cards. You may choose a different target for each instance of the word "target" on the resulting spell.
If all of the spell's targets are illegal when the spell tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen.

cards.originalText:
Tap or untap target permanent.
Splice onto Arcane {U} (As you play an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

cards.name: Reach Through Mists
cards.text: Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Know one part of the name, obsession begins. Know two parts, paranoia sets in. Know three parts, madness descends. Know all, and only the kami know what will become of you."
—Lady Azami
cards.originalText: Draw a card.

cards.name: Reweave
cards.text:
Target permanent's controller sacrifices it. If the player does, they reveal cards from the top of their library until they reveal a permanent card that shares a card type with the sacrificed permanent, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle their library.
Splice onto Arcane {2}{U}{U} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

rulings.text: When Reweave resolves it uses the type(s) that the permanent had right before it was sacrificed.
The player reveals cards only if the targeted permanent gets sacrificed.

With the introduction of the Tribal type it became possible for an instant or sorcery card to share a type with the sacrificed permanent (ie, a Tribal instant card shares a type with a Tribal Enchantment card). Reweave has received errata so that the effect looks for a *permanent* card that shares a type with the sacrificed permanent. A permanent card is a card that could be put onto the battlefield, which is any card that isn't an instant or sorcery.
You reveal all cards you intend to splice at the same time. Each individual card can be spliced only once onto any one spell.
A card with a splice ability can't be spliced onto itself because the spell is on the stack (and not in your hand) when you reveal the cards you want to splice onto it.

You choose all targets for the spell after revealing cards you want to splice, including any targets required by the text of any of those cards. You may choose a different target for each instance of the word "target" on the resulting spell.
If all of the spell's targets are illegal when the spell tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen.

cards.originalText:
Target permanent's controller sacrifices it. That player reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a card that shares a card type with the sacrificed permanent. The player puts that card into play, then shuffles his or her library.
Splice onto Arcane {2}{U}{U}

cards.name: River Kaijin
cards.flavor:
"Since the war began, fishermen don't sing to the kaijin to ask for full nets. They guard the shore with thrice-blessed spears, saving the nets for their wives to pack their belongings and leave."
—Hayato, master sailor
